text.text: Attractiveness of Virtual Characters Thank you for your interest in this study. In this experiment, you will be shown images of some computer generated female faces. When prompted, your task will be to rate how
text.text2: the face is. This experiment will take approximately 5 minutes to complete. Prior to the experiment, you will be asked to answer a few general background questions and give your consent to participate in the research. You will also be required to complete a short pre-test. Finally, you can read a short description of the study at the end.

TRIAL.text: <.text>CONSENT FORM. Your final results will be kept strictly confidential. Your data will be stored using a unique ID number and, as such, the experimenter will not be able to identify your data or link your personal details (e.g. your name, email) with your data. You are free to withdraw from this study at any time during the duration of the experiment without any penalty. Incomplete data will be excluded from analysis. If you withdraw from this study, you can still take part in any of the other on-going experiments. Statement of Informed consent: I understand the general purpose of this experiment I understand that I can withdraw from the study at any time and that in doing so my data will be destroyed and not included in the study. I understand that my responses are anonymous. My data will be grouped with other participants and these group results will be presented in scientific papers and conferences. I agree to take part in this experiment. By clicking the “I consent” button below you agree to participate in the study. </.text>

text.text: What is your country of origin
What is your country of residence
What is your race?---What is your sexual orientation?

checkBoxes.labels: White,Hispanic or Latino,Black or African,Native American,Asian/Pacific Islander,Other---Straight,Gay,Bisexual

text.text: Your task is to rate how
text.text2: you think a given face is when prompted. After each image presentation, drag the triangle-shaped indicator to your preferred position on a scale from “very
text.text6: ” using the mouse. Please utilize the whole scale when rating the faces. Please respond quickly but accurately.

TRIAL.text: <.text>DEBRIEF Thank you for participating in our study. There has been a lot of research in human studies involving behavioural and physical features of a person that can facilitate attraction in a viewer. Through this experiment we are looking at how different facial features impact perceived attractiveness of virtual characters. We investigated this by asking you to rate the attractiveness of characters whose features had been manipulated. Your answers on the questionnaire will be used in the research to examine the correlations between a number of personal attributes (such as gender, sexual orientation) and perceived attractiveness of virtual characters. This experiment was part of a larger project which aims to apply principles of human perceptual processing to endow virtual social agents with maximum appeal. These virtual characters may then be useful in different settings, such as gaming, health care and education. Thank you for participating! If you have any further questions regarding this study please do not hesitate to contact me. Yours sincerely, Pikki Hogan(hopi@tcd.ie) Principal Investigator: Professor Fiona Newell Institute of Neuroscience and School of Psychology Trinity College Dublin, Ireland PLEASE REMEMBER TO VISIT THE BELOW LINK SO PROLFIC ACADEMIC KNOWS YOU HAVE COMPLETED THE STUDY. THANKS. </.text>
